file_summary: This Java test class, `I18nPropertiesSyncTest`, is responsible for enforcing internationalization (i18n) best practices within the Spring PetClinic application. It performs two critical checks to ensure consistent and complete translation coverage. First, `checkNonInternationalizedStrings()` scans all `.java` and `.html` source files (excluding test files) to identify any hard-coded text literals within HTML that are not marked for internationalization (e.g., missing Thymeleaf `#{...}` expressions or `th:text` attributes). This prevents untranslated strings from appearing in the UI. Second, `checkI18nPropertyFilesAreInSync()` verifies that all locale-specific `messages_*.properties` translation files contain every key present in the base `messages.properties` file, ensuring that no strings are partially translated or missing across different languages. This comprehensive test suite helps maintain high quality and completeness for the application's internationalization.

functions.name: checkNonInternationalizedStrings
functions.description: Scans `.java` and `.html` files in `src/main` for hard-coded text literals. Specifically, for HTML files, it identifies text directly within tags that are not marked with Thymeleaf's internationalization expressions (`#{...}`) or attributes (`th:text`), failing the test if found.

functions.name: checkI18nPropertyFilesAreInSync
functions.description: Verifies that all locale-specific `messages_*.properties` files contain every key defined in the base `messages.properties` file, ensuring complete translation coverage across all supported languages and preventing partial translations.
